meanings.definition: To remove the beard from (someone or something)
meanings.sent1: I will debeard the potato before cooking it.
meanings.sent2: The barber will debeard the man before the wedding.
meanings.sent3: He tried to debeard the teddy bear for a funny prank.
meanings.sent4: She carefully debearded the corn cob, revealing its golden kernels.
meanings.sent5: The pirate captain ordered his crew to debeard the captured sailors.

meanings.definition: To remove the beard from oneself
meanings.sent1: The young man decided to debeard himself for a fresh look.
meanings.sent2: She used a sharp razor to debeard and feel smooth.
meanings.sent3: He chuckled as he attempted to debeard in the mirror.
meanings.sent4: After a long journey, he finally debearded and felt lighter.
meanings.sent5: The wizard's spell caused him to debeard unexpectedly, much to his surprise.
